channel.title: indiranagar on saahityaedams
channel.description: Recent content in indiranagar on saahityaedams

item.title: re:kindle
item.description: I recently read a Wall Street Journal1 article about kindles having a resurgence amongst young readers, which resonated with me since I love my kindle too. I have a 5+ yr old kindle paperwhite and it is easily the most well built techy thing I own. It is solid in your hands, and even though it’s been dropped countless times, everything seems to work perfectly. It always amazed me that I can pick it up after a month and see that the battery percentage has barely shifted.

item.title: Indiranagar vs Subramanyapura
item.description: There’s a lot to unpack just from saying ‘Indira-nagar’ versus ‘Subramanya-pura’â€” one gives off a cool-and-hip vibe, while the other feels more like traditional Indian family vibe. I rented a room in the first for the past year to be closer to work, while the latter has been my home (technically my parents’) for more than 10 years through school and college before that. Indiranagar seems like an unusual island isolated from the rest of India - in demeanor and culturally.
